revision.comment: /* Science and technology */ unlikely that anyone is using this name, and it would be pointed at the disease anyway, not the virus
revision.text:
{{wiktionary|Car|car|CAR|Appendix:Variations of "car"}}
A '''[[car]]''' is a wheeled motor vehicle used for transporting passengers.
'''Car''', '''Cars''', '''CAR''' or '''CARs''' may also refer to:
{{TOC right}}
==Places== * [[Central African Republic]] * [[Cordillera Administrative Region]], a region of the Philippines * [[Caraga]], a region of the Philippines officially known as the Caraga Administrative Region * [[Car, Azerbaijan]], a village * [[Čar]], a village in Serbia * [[Cars, Gironde]], France, a commune * [[Les Cars]], Haute-Vienne, France, a commune
==People== * [[Car (King of Caria)]] * [[Car (Greek myth)]] * [[Car (surname)]] * [[Jean-François Cars]] (1670–1739), French engraver * [[Laurent Cars]] (1699–1771), French designer and engraver
==Transportation== * Car, the cab of an [[elevator]] * Car, a [[tram]], streetcar, or trolley car * [[Canada Atlantic Railway]], 1879–1914 * [[Canadian Atlantic Railway]], 1986–1994 * [[Railroad car]] * CAR, the station code for [[Carlisle railway station]]
==Arts, entertainment, and media== ===Films=== * [[Cars (franchise)|''Cars'' (franchise)]], a Disney/Pixar film series ** [[Cars (film)|''Cars'' (film)]], a 2006 computer animated film from Disney and Pixar ** ''[[Cars 2]]'', the 2011 sequel ** ''[[Cars 3]]'', the 2017 sequel * [[Cars 3 (2009 film)|''Cars 3'' (2009 film)]], a 2009 comedy action film not related to the Disney/Pixar series * ''[[The Car]]'', a 1977 suspense-horror film * [[The Car (1997 film)|''The Car'' (1997 film)]], a Malayalam film
===Games=== * [[Cars (video game)|''Cars'' (video game)]], a 2006 video game based on the Disney/Pixar film ** [[Cars 2 (video game)|''Cars 2'' (video game)]], a 2011 video game based on the film ''Cars 2'' ** ''[[Cars 3: Driven to Win]]'', a 2017 video game based on the film ''Cars 3''
===Music=== * [[The Cars]], an American rock band
====Albums==== * [[C.A.R. (album)|''C.A.R.'' (album)]], a 2012 album by American hip hop artist Serengeti * [[Cars (Now, Now Every Children album)|''Cars'' (Now, Now Every Children album)]], a 2008 album * [[The Cars (album)|''The Cars'' (album)]] by The Cars * [[Peter Gabriel (1977 album)|''Peter Gabriel'' (1977 album)]], one of four albums of that name, often distinguished as "Car" because of its cover illustration * [[Cars (soundtrack)|''Cars'' (soundtrack)]], the soundtrack to the 2006 film * ''Cars'', an album by [[Kris Delmhorst]]
====Songs==== * "Car", a song by Built to Spill on their 1994 album ''[[There's Nothing Wrong with Love]]'' * [[Cars (song)|"Cars" (song)]], a 1979 single by Gary Numan * [[The Car (song)|"The Car" (song)]], by Jeff Carson
===Visual arts=== * [[Cars (painting)|''Cars'' (painting)]], a series of paintings by Andy Warhol * [[The Car (Brack)|''The Car'' (Brack)]], a 1955 painting by John Brack
===Other uses in arts, entertainment, and media=== * [[Car (magazine)|''Car'' (magazine)]], a British auto-enthusiast publication * [[The Car (novel)|''The Car'' (novel)]], by Gary Paulsen * [[The Car (The Assistants episode)|"The Car" (''The Assistants'' episode)]], the first episode of the Nickelodeon sitcom
==Economics and finance== * [[Capital adequacy ratio]], a ratio of a bank's capital to its risk * [[Cost accrual ratio]], an accounting formula * [[Cumulative abnormal return]] * [[Cumulative average return]], a financial concept related to the time value of money
==Military and firearms== * [[Canadian Airborne Regiment]], a Canadian Forces formation * [[Colt Automatic Rifle]], a 5.56mm NATO firearm * [[Combat Action Ribbon]], a United States military decoration * [[U.S. Army Combat Arms Regimental System]], a 1950s reorganisation of the regiments of the US Army
==Organisations== * [[Action Committee for Renewal]] (''Comité d'Action pour la Renouveau''), a political party of Togo * [[Carolina Panthers]], a professional football team in Charlotte, North Carolina * [[Children of the American Revolution]], a genealogical society * [[Rugby Africa]], formerly known as Confederation of African Rugby
==Science and technology== *[[Canonical anticommutation relation]], a concept in quantum field theory * [[C.a.R.]] (Z.u.L.), "compass and ruler", geometry software * [[CAR and CDR]], computer programming operations first introduced in the LISP language * [[Carina (constellation)]], astronomical constellation abbreviation "Car" * [[Catecholamine]] releaser, a hormone releaser * [[Chimeric antigen receptor]], artificial T cell receptors * [[Clock with Adaptive Replacement]], a page replacement algorithm * Cocksackie Adenovirus Receptor, alternative symbol CAR for the human gene [[CXADR]] * [[Coherent anti-Stokes Raman spectroscopy]], a form of spectroscopy used primarily in chemistry, physics and related fields * [[Computer-assisted reporting]], the use of computers in researching news stories * [[Computer-assisted reviewing]], the use of computer software for more effective text reviewing * [[Constitutive androstane receptor]] * [[Cortisol awakening response]], a physiological response when a person wakes up
==Other uses== * Car, the spelling of [[tsar]] in several Slavic languages *[[Car language]], an Austroasiatic language of the Nicobar Islands in the eastern Indian Ocean * [[CARs]] or Canadian Aviation Regulations * [[Central apparatus room]], an equipment room found at broadcasting facilities * [[Club Always Ready]], a Bolivian football club from La Paz * [[Criminal Appeal Reports]] * [[Charles Duguid#Other interests|Council for Aboriginal Rights]], historical organisation in Australia
==See also== {{srt|dab}} *[[Cari (disambiguation)]] * [[Carr (disambiguation)]] * [[CARS (disambiguation)]] * [[Le Car (disambiguation)]] * [[Passenger car (disambiguation)]] * {{in title|Car}} * {{look from|Car}}
{{Disambiguation|geo}}
